content: For our CDS project this year, we're aiming to build out a guide for using CDS Hooks to satisfy PAMA requirements. I'm wondering if anyone who's actively done work in this space already (e.g., to build a qualified CDSM) might be willing to give an overview of the rules/process in this Friday's call. @Alex Tatiyants is it possible someone at Stanson might? Or, other ideas?
@Josh Mandel Happy to do it, can you share the call info? thanks

Awesome! It's Friday at noon ET (GoToMeeting: https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/112752565). Our goals are to understand the PAMA requirement, the population it applies to, the timing, the valid sources of decision support logic, the process of becoming a qualified CDSM, and/or anything else you think we should know -- especially any information about the technologies being used to meet the requirements today :-)
Sure. How much time do you think I will have? I have another meeting at noon and I'm to figure out how late I'm going to be to it.
How much time do you expect you will need? I was thinking ~20-30 mins
I'll plan for 30 in case there are questions
